intro: Myrovernix scaber, commonly known as the rough myroblain, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its rough, hairy stems and leaves give it a distinctive appearance, and it thrives in cool, moist environments. Myrovernix scaber is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
